3.122. 
Securing the division of property 
At the request of one of the spouses or of the spouses' creditors, the court may seize property which is the community property of the spouses or appoint a receiver if this is necessary to protect the spouses' rights in the community property or the rights of creditors. These measures shall not apply if the other spouse provides adequate security for the claims of the spouse requesting the seizure of the property or the appointment of an administrator or for the claims of the creditors.
